Topic.Title: IMO Company Needs To Issue Shares-At Least $300 million

Message.Msg: I can wait the year. This is my long term hold, and was priced presuming it would be spending SEVERAL years as dead money. That it'll spend considerably LESS time as dead money than originally thought is where the real news is, and why the stock is holding its own despite the $200M in loss provisions for this year.

Topic.Title: We named the airport in our national capital for a man who sold weapons stolen from Pentagon warehouses to Ayatollah Khomeini

Message.Msg: We had no "terrorist list" per se in 1982, and if we did the Mudjahideen were not on it. In fact we were funneling them so much material that the ONLY thing surprising is we were giving them a MANPAD than some main Army formations hadn't gotten yet. (those units were still fielding REDEYE when we were giving a limited number of Stinger units to the Mudj) Groups on our "terrorists list" back then were almost entirely communist backed and socialist aligned. Red Brigades, Baader-Meinhof Gang, Shining Path, etc etc etc.

Message.Title: the consensus of real scientists
Message.Msg: al gore is fat , therefore global warming does not exist. as if we even need the science. It still snows a lot in winter too! and plus the bible says there will be no global warming: in Genesis 8:22, we’re told of a promise by God never to use global floodwaters again as a means of destroying life on Earth. In that promise, the Bible explicitly states: “While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.”

silly, silly man! why would anyone who can think , think that science is biblical dogma? science is falsifiable. the fact of global warming is a verifiable fact which NO scientist , or honest person denies or could prove false. And there is a consensus among climate scientists that the recent rise in global average temperature is caused by human fossil fuel burning, although there are one or two climate scientists who disagree.

Message.Title: Republican Backlash Claims 5 More Senators !
Message.Msg: It gets worse every day for the Pubs who voted against the gun bill . Sen. Lisa Murkowski's (R-Alaska) net approval rating dropped 16 points, as she shed much of her previous cross-party appeal. Sen. Rob Portman (R-Ohio) saw his numbers dive 18 points, from a positive to a negative rating. Not all of the change can be attributed to the vote. Portman, for instance, saw his approval drop among Republicans when he announced his support for gay marriage in March. But in Alaska, Arizona, Nevada and Ohio, at least 60 percent of voters supported background checks, and many expressed disappointment with politicians who voted otherwise.................. IT'S THE BEGINNING OF THE END FOR CAVE DWELLERS ! hehe

Absolutely no warming ? How do they explain the massive melting of glaciers ? The northern seas opening up with no ice ? Sea levels rising ? Only a right wingnut could see glaciers melt and think nothing changes.
It takes a very small mind to think your local climate reflects the entire planet.

Message.Title: Grover Norquist move over!
Message.Msg: Internet sales tax bill roils GOP alliances The tax pledge fanatic is wetting his pants, because more politicians reject the anti-tax pledge he created. The internet sales tax billcleared its finalhurdle on a bipartisan Senate vote 63-30. Final Senate pessage is scheduled for next Monday, and that tally is likely to be even more strongly in favor. Earlier test votes won as many as 75 yeses. And House action, once unthinkable, mabe unstoppable. Many Pubs have just shrugged. The bill's supporters include tea party conservatives like Sen. Ron Johnson, R-Wis, and GOP leaders like Sen. John Thune of South Dekota. They argue that the bill, which could generate $24 billion in new tax revenue, is not a tax increase at all. It only ensures that taxes already owed are actually paid.
